explains: n. 仔细观察，详细审查

sentences.en: Her argument doesn't really stand up to scrutiny.
sentences.cn: 她的观点经不起认真推敲。

sentences.en: Foreign policy has come under close scrutiny recently.
sentences.cn: 近来，政府的外交政策受到了认真彻底的审查。

sentences.en: Public scrutiny had brought civil servants out from the backroom and into the spotlight.
sentences.cn: 公开审查使得公务员从幕后变成焦点。
